intro: Gomesa barbata, commonly known as the hairy gomesia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and large, palmately lobed leaves. Its flowers are typically showy, with five petals and a prominent central column. Gomesa barbata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
